intro: Anisomeris englesingii, commonly known as the Englesing's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. Anisomeris englesingii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
